intro: Palicourea vichadensis, commonly known as the Vichada palicourea, is a climbing shrub native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, spherical berries. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
